reviews.review_msg: I really enjoyed taking her class. She gives detailed instructions for assignment that we know what to do in order to get good mark. Very fair exam. She provides us course notes but reading textbook is unavoidable.

Very fair instructor. Mainly studied from notes which come straight from the textbook. Not the easiest class, but Sheri makes it as interesting as possible. Managed to get an A in research methods. She even gives you an outline for your paper that if you follow completely will get you a great mark. Awesome instructor!
B-O-R-I-N-G... i totally do not recommend her!
A nice person, very nice and helpful, but makes the material kind of boring. She's well organized, but it's almost too well organized to make it interesting.

Wow!! research methods was actually interesting!! Sheri has an absolutely amazing energy she puts into her teaching, this seems to rub off on the students....good work!!!  Sheri is the most helpful and approachable Prof I have ever encountered...Bravo!!! at SFU this really is unusual.
Bad posture, actually expected students to do the reading on time and then got upset when no one did, good course though
He's amazing to look at, but not that great of a teacher for Stats stuff if you have trouble with anything math-related.  Heard he gives less work than Davies for 320 tho...

did not read the text book, boombed the term paper, but still managed a B- his exams are extremly easy, he teaches everything in the lec if not the TA will teach in the tut. Bad accent, yes, but totally hot! do not mind staring at him for 2 hrs..*hahaha
No Comments

Patrick was wonderful~ Look past the accent and he really knows his stuff (especially those sex offenders)! His tests are totally in line with the book and the lectures, and his powerpoint lectures are extremely well organized. I was surprised at how painless he made a research methods course.

It's true that Lussier isn't the most fluent in English, but I think the fact that he outlines things so clearly on overheads or powerpoint makes up for it. His tests are fair and he does the best he can with the (very dull) class content by pulling in some more interesting outside sources.
No Comments
Not interesting at all.

It was an online class, so I have never seen him. However he is the author of the textbook and weekly modules, so I can rate him according to them. The textbook was very dry and contained a lot of useless information. His lectures were little bit more interesting, but it seems like he did not change them for at least five years.

i took this online during the summer, Ted as the actual teacher didn't do anything, the TA was sooo helpful she is the only reason i did so well. you have to rely on the textbook since no lectures, there were 2 online quizzes that were very hard, one paper with a separate proposal, and then the final which was much easier than the online quizzes

Book makes the course so much worse. Chapters are too long & dry, they don't get down to the point. Essays also take up so much time & are too long to get a direct point across. Taken online so I can't assess teaching abilities.

Avoid the online section unless you have no choice. The textbook was super dry and very hard to read. The foundation of the final exam is based off of the text so if you don't read, prepare to fail. There are 2 quizzes; make sure you know the material - it is TIMED. Also 2 10 page papers. The TM was picky so make sure you understand the guidelines.

Took this class online. Two tests worth 15 % each and you're online given 10 minutes to answer, too rushed to complete it. Essays marked mediocre but take a long time to complete. The book is one of the most boring books ever and you have to read every chapter of it with chapters ranging from 30-40 dry pages each. would not take him again

Dr. Palys is a friendly and approachable prof. Passionate about this subject and is very willing to help. Read the textbook and review the study questions at the end of each chapter and you'll do well.

Very passionate about online privacy and ethics. Many research stories to tell that reflect the research decisions chapters in the powerpoint slides. Marks hella tough but you get some leverage with the TA marking the other half of everything. Does a good job emphasizing key points/ concepts multiple times in slides. Lectures can get a bit dry

Do not take this course. It is extremely difficult (according to the low 60's class average). The material can be hard to understand if you do not have a background or interest in research methods, but there are no recordings, videos, etc. to help in explaining the concepts. Quizzes are very detailed with limited time. Assignments are marked tough

For someone who teaches ethics, he better have some ethics himself. I can't believe how arrogant someone can be because he has a PHD. He will probably talk about his PHD degree 100 times by the end of the semester. For those who are going to take this course: good luck because that is the only thing that can get you through his hideous character.

Most boring class ever; most boring text ever. Take this class with a different prof and it might get some life. It felt like death to sit there for 2 hours a week. The text book is repetitive and not effective. The research paper was as boring to write as im sure it was to read: who cares to listen for 25 pages about a simple "life event"?
He's a nice guy and the course was not that bad. Just the lecture notes and read the book, you'll do fine. Over all - I recommend him.
the paper was hard, kinda boring, but he was so very helpful. he wanted to see all his students do well, and he's a very nice guy.

Ted is a very laid back instructor who is very easy to approach. Although at times his lectures can get extremely boring, his midterm and final are fairly easy. Since he is the author of the textbook used, his notes are identical to his textbook material.
No Comments
Boring material, but easy class. The midterm and final were pretty much mirrored questions out of the textbook. The research paper, however, was a nightmare.
He was able to make unbeleivably boring material some what interesting. The class overall was easy but the marking between TA's was not consistent.

Ted put all his notes on pp and his website. Was clear with his explanations. But the course material itself was boring. Tests are fairly easy. Research paper was very time consuming. One TA was way too hard of a marker.
Ted made a boring class somewhat interesting.  Explains everything well.  The midterm was VERY EASY!0
take his class (220) by distance ed.  easiest thing i've ever done.

Barry is fantastic!!! He makes the dry material of CRIM 220 very interesting. Attendance in his classes is a must as he mainly tests on his lecture notes. Replies e-mails very quickly and is extremely friendly when you talk to him face-to-face. Take his courses because you will be rewarded with good grades if you put the effort in. A+ professor!!!
One of the most awesome profs you'll ever have. if you have any class lined up with him teaching, take it without even thinking.

Barry is by far my favorite prof at SFU. I have taken 3 courses with him & plan 2 take more. If you don't study the notes & attend lecture your screwed. Exams are very fair, if your not good at T/F or M/C you can make it up in the written & definitons. Mark Lokanan was a really good TA. Take 220 with Barry if you can. Makes dry material interesting
freaking awesome, great prof, funny, turns driest course into something worth taking. kinda reminds me of a shorter version of dirty harry, least he dresses like him. Apparently he was/is in a band
Very entertaining professor. Take his class and expect a stud muffin.
Too easy for words. The short answers are a little more tricky though.
Awesome

He seems like a nice guy but not the best prof. I went to the first few lectures, but after being told numerous times that everything we need to know is in the textbook and he won't introduce any new information in lecture, I stopped attending. He basically discourages attendance. Exams were fair but papers are long. Tutorials weren't very helpful.

Lectures are mostly useless, he mostly draws exam questions from the textbook overall, tests and assignment (2 papers: research proposal) are easy marks Just remember to follow instructions in the papers, it will be an easy A.

Textbook is essential, due to useless lectures. Lectures are basically constructed of being told everything is in the text. Slides are changed before you can even read a word, thus taking notes is not even a possibility. Two papers, pretty long, but easy marks. Overall, tests and papers are not difficult. Lectures are definitely useless though.

His lectures start off as "everything is in the textbook so I'll just show exactly what you already read". Taking notes is completely pointless as he switches slides before you can even read the first line. He also doesn't help you at all and only sends you which textbook pages to read when you do need help. Worst class I've ever taken. STAY AWAY!
If you're planning to take notes off his lecture slides I hope you have photographic memory because he will change a slide with 50 words before you can even blink 2 times

He seems like a laid back guy. I had him for CRIM 220 and the class is supposed to be 1 hour and 50 minutes long, but his lecture would only last about a hour or less, so you'd always be out of class early. Just make sure to read the textbook for the exams as his slides are pretty useless.

Took by distance. Midterm was take home fact pattern, as were assignments. TA Michelle is communicative, helpful and intelligent. You may bring the Criminal Code to your final. Lots of memorization of cases, but overall very interesting, and Verdun-Jones' textbook is amazingly clear. I would definitely take another class with him.
wonderful
A little too animated some times. Very loud. Very knowledgable
